and crashed: Can anyone tell me how I can format a disk for fat32 from Linux?
it said I was attempting to create too large of a filesystem
sorry, work happened.  So I mkdosfs -F 32 /dev/sdc1 ?

(mkdosfs creates only up to fat16 as default, and it has a rather low size limit)
yes, I noticed, just thought I'd explain it also ;)

that's probably just because fat doesn't support permissions so they can't be preserved
the data will probably be fine
okay good. :) thanks.  And the drive even nicely automounts now
